file_content.text: Your service has been greatly appreciated, but your work here is done.
There's no time to waste. Move out!
Here's the data from the Dark Council chambers, Colonel.
Congratulations. You just succeeded in a mission many people never dared to dream was possible. We've proven that victory--true victory--is within reach.
Just imagine: all of the Emperor's followers, truly defeated at last. We're close now, I'm sure of it. This is a great day.
Now that we've attacked Korriban, how long will it be until the Republic can move against Dromund Kaas?
What's the next step?
Purely a matter of logistics. If we can open up the lines from--
The success of this operation depends on you. Remember that.
...Blue Squadron approaches Korriban at maximum speed. Bombing commences on signal "aurek". Wave one shuttle follows and secures the LZ...
...and then wave two comes in. Perfect timing.
You're actually planning an attack on Korriban?
Yes. And your part in the plan is critical.
This is Colonel Darok--he's in charge of the op. I'm Theron Shan, SIS. We spoke on the holo.
So we're invading Korriban--take me through your plan.
Tell me about your plan.
Any relation to the Jedi Grandmaster, Satele Shan?
Shan? That's a familiar name.
This is why I keep asking for a codename.
We aren't here to discuss genealogy. Time is critical.
Our objective is to raid the Sith Academy. Specifically, the databanks held inside the Dark Council chambers on the Academy's upper level.
The information in those databanks could win the war. Once the first attack wave clears a landing zone, it will be your job to go in and get them.
And once we have the data? What then?
You will exfiltrate immediately and rendezvous back here. My associate, Commander Jensyn, will remain behind to collect secondary objectives as time allows.
Hit the academy, grab the data, and escape. When do we begin?
Very well.
Immediately.
Have the Empire's forces really become so weak that we can charge straight in like this?
What about enemy defenses?
Not exactly. We'll be exploiting a brief gap in their patrols, which is why we have to move immediately.
If we're going into the Sith Academy, we shouldn't just grab a few trinkets. We should level the place.
Let's do as much damage as possible.
Bigger job, bigger payout--is that your line of thinking?
You don't need us to tell you how tough this will be. The Sith Academy is one of the most secure locations in the entire galaxy.
Why didn't you just tell me the target up front?
You never mentioned Korriban.
The sooner we can stop the Sith, the sooner the galaxy can finally know peace.
Agreed.
I think you underestimate the tenacity of the Sith. This was one battle--we still have many more ahead of us.
Don't be too proud of yourself.
I don't ask much in return. A moderately-sized parade, one or two landmarks named after me....
Let's talk rewards.
It's Tython! We need everything we've got!
What are you talking about?
Imperial forces just hit Tython. Iso-5 bombings, strike teams in the Jedi Temple... they need our support, now!
Our forces are sweeping the rest of the muck off of Tython as we speak, and reconstruction crews are already being prepped.
This could have been much worse. Thanks to you, the enemy has only bloodied our nose--and hardened our resolve.
The timing of this attack--just as we made our own assault on Korriban? It's too much to be a coincidence.
It's possible the enemy's intelligence isn't the shambles we were led to believe. I'm sure the SIS will determine how this slip-up happened.
Yes. We will.
All the same, you've succeeded in two critical missions for the Republic, back to back. You're heroes, and you deserve to be recognized.
Even so, you've just won two critical battles for the Republic, back to back. You're a hero, and heroes deserve to be recognized.
The medal of valor. No commendation this prestigious has ever been awarded so quickly; the Chancellor was truly impressed. As am I. Congratulations.
I appreciate the recognition, Colonel. But there's still more to do.
Thank you.
The timing of the attacks, Colonel--and the message from that Sith lord. We have to figure out what really happened here.
I still have questions.
Keep the trinkets, Colonel. We need to find the person responsible for this and deal with them.
Forget the blasted medals.
We have the information you gathered. I'm sure we'll identify the culprit very soon.
Now, then: I've been tasked with organizing the Tython cleanup, and I want to be sure the Jedi Council knows they have our full support. If you'll excuse me.
I don't know about you, but I need a drink.
If we're fortunate, the Empire will realize they're beaten sooner rather than later.
Maybe the Sith will surrender.
An end to this war? I could stand to see that.
That's what I signed up for.
I don't know about you, Colonel, but I prefer to spend my great days in the cantina.
We should be celebrating!
So, I normally charge by cargo mass. I don't know Korriban's mass offhand, but I'm sure if we check the HoloNet....
Let's talk rewards.
How did this happen?
If you're willing to help, we might be able to find out.
Blue Squadron: complete refueling operations and launch immediately. Any wave one troops not injured on Korriban: re-equip and board shuttles.
Shan, you gather whatever sensor data we have and forward it to all forces. I want everyone en route in five. Move!
Stopping the Empire may call for more than just our strike force. Can we count on reinforcements?
Can we get more backup?
I'll arrange for every available resource while you're in transit. We don't have time to wait, though.
This is too much to be a coincidence. I don't think it's wise to rush in.
We need to stop and think.
This is your home base being attacked, Master Jedi. You can meditate on the ramifications later.
We're soldiers. It's not our job to decide what's wise, it's our job to fight the enemy.
If it's as unwise as you think, we'll up your pay.
The Empire must not be allowed to capture Tython. We cannot afford to hesitate. Period.
Time to make the Empire wish they'd never even heard of Tython.
Let's go!
Agreed. Don't hold anything back.
Speed is what I'm known for. We'll have Tython back before you know it.
You got it!
Good.
I'll pull up every bit of data we've got and talk you through the whole way. Good luck.
I know it's hard to leave an operation sometimes. I've been there. But your part is done.
We will. But you've done more than enough for one day.
That may be wishful thinking--
The homeworld of the Sith... this is much more serious than you led me to believe.
You never mentioned Korriban.
I assumed you'd just grab the facts right out of my head.
Enough.
Open comms aren't the safest place for honesty.
If you had told me the plan up front, I would've had you start paying me right then and there.
You never mentioned Korriban.
Sounds like I made the right move, then.
I never expected such a ruthless plan from a Jedi.
You and I think very much alike.
Regardless, it's not an option. There isn't time to land the necessary hardware for a full-scale demolition. We'll take what we can get.
But if we succeed... we could learn more about the Empire's moves than every SIS operation from the past decade combined.
Our forces are ready. Victory for the Republic depends on you.
Then I'll go immediately. May the Force be with us.
Good luck.
You can always rely on the Jedi to aid in such important tasks.
May the Force be with you.
Havoc Squad won't let you down, Colonel.
"Dependable" is my middle name!
Move out.
